terms.reconciliation: process of making actual state match desired state through continuous comparison and correction
terms.finalizer: metadata field preventing deletion until cleanup operations complete
terms.admission webhook: HTTP endpoint receiving admission review requests to validate or mutate resources
terms.informer: client-side cache watching API server events with local cache for efficient reads
terms.custom resource definition: API extension defining new resource types with OpenAPI v3 schema validation
terms.controller pattern: software design where control loop continuously observes and acts to maintain desired state
terms.feedback loop: continuous cycle of measuring current state, comparing to desired state, and taking corrective action
terms.exponential backoff: retry strategy that increases delay between attempts to prevent overwhelming failing systems
terms.owner reference: metadata field establishing parent-child relationships between resources for garbage collection
terms.validating webhook: admission webhook that can deny resource operations but cannot modify resources
terms.mutating webhook: admission webhook that can modify resources before they are stored
terms.admission review: Kubernetes API object containing resource data and metadata for webhook processing
terms.JSON patch: RFC 6902 standard for describing changes to JSON documents using operations like add, replace, remove
terms.TLS certificate management: provisioning, renewal, and distribution of X.509 certificates for webhook HTTPS communication
terms.cert-manager: Kubernetes operator that automates certificate lifecycle management
terms.gatekeeper pattern: security model where admission webhooks act as control points that inspect and authorize resource operations
terms.certificate rotation: automatic renewal and replacement of TLS certificates before expiration
terms.admission control: Kubernetes mechanism for intercepting API requests before they reach storage
terms.optimistic locking: concurrency control assuming conflicts are rare, detecting conflicts only at write time
terms.resource version: monotonically increasing identifier for resource modifications used for conflict detection
terms.leader election: distributed coordination mechanism ensuring only one controller replica actively reconciles
terms.eventual consistency: distributed systems property where updates propagate over time but may not be immediately visible
terms.conflict resolution: process of handling concurrent resource modifications without data loss
terms.RBAC: Role-Based Access Control for managing permissions in Kubernetes
terms.principle of least privilege: security practice of granting minimum permissions necessary for operation
terms.distroless: minimal container images containing only application and runtime dependencies
terms.extension points: architectural patterns that allow new functionality to be added without breaking existing behavior
terms.controller composition: coordination strategies for multiple controllers managing related resources
terms.sharding strategy: method for partitioning resources across multiple controller instances
terms.cross-controller coordination: communication patterns between controllers managing related resources
terms.horizontal scaling: adding more controller instances to handle increased resource load
terms.vertical scaling: increasing computational resources for individual controller instances
terms.informer cache optimization: reducing memory usage and improving cache efficiency in controller informers
terms.reconciliation batching: grouping related reconciliation operations to reduce API server load
terms.incremental reconciliation: tracking fine-grained resource changes to avoid unnecessary work
terms.multi-cluster operations: managing resources that span multiple Kubernetes clusters
terms.federation controllers: controllers that coordinate resources across multiple clusters
terms.performance monitoring: collecting and analyzing metrics for operator scaling and optimization
